citation.article-title: Phylogeny and molecular taxonomy of the Bacillus subtilis species complex and description of Bacillus subtilis subsp. inaquosorum subsp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacillus subtilis subsp. inaquosorum subsp. nov.

Bacillus subtilis subsp. inaquosorum [in.a.quo.so′rum. L. adj. inaquosus poor of water, L. gen. pl. n. (solium) inaquosorum from (soils) poor of water (desert soils) from which this organism was isolated].
Vegetative cells are rods that measure 0.5×3 μm and occur either singly or in chains.
Cylindrical spores form centrally or paracentrally in non-swollen sporangia.
Facultatively anaerobic on TGY agar or broth.
Grows at 15–55 °C, with optimum growth at 28–30 °C.
Growth in 10 % (w/v) NaCl occurs after 72 h.
Growth in the presence of 0.001 % (w/v) lysozyme is variable.
Hydrolyses starch and casein; reduces nitrate to nitrite.
Acid is produced from amygdalin, glycogen, melibiose, d-glucose, cellobiose, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol and aesculin ferric citrate, as determined using the API CH 50 system.
Produces a surfactin-like lipopeptide [M+Na]+ molecular adduct ion product of mass m/z 1120.8 in MALDI-TOF MS analysis.
The type strain is NRRL B-23052T (=KCTC 13429T=BGSC 3A28T) and is archived within the ARS Culture Collection, the Korean Collection for Type Cultures and the Bacillus Genetic Stock Center.
Strains form distinct monophyletic clusters from other B. subtilis subspecies in concatenated gene sequence phylogenies.
